title: What is the meaning of the line 'I've seen some things that a woman ain't supposed to see' in the song Never Been to Me? - Quora

response.answer_text: There seem to be a lot of mixed feelings about this song. Written by two men, some feel it carries a message not consistent with today’s view of equality. “I’ve seen some things that a woman ain’t supposed to see”, probably refers to a life (gender roles being moot) of choosing what makes her feel good, what she really wants to do as a person, not a woman. She has a strong sexually appetite, many lovers/no restrictions, perhaps an abortion (or two), choosing her way on her terms, and not what would be expected of a “good girl”. No boundaries. The line, ‘undressed by kings’, might refer not just to scope, but perhaps prostitution. Meaning Of The Line You Requested: conservative notions about the “good girl”, one who shouldn’t, perhaps, seen and experienced all the singer suggests she’s done. Charlene - I've Never Been To Me Lyrics | SongMeanings
